title: @Meddler or Statikk or anyone involved in the mid year mage update.
body:
The gameplay board is maybe not the right place for this kind of question but i don't know what artists will be involved in the update:
With the mid year mage update will some of the champions get a visual touch up? 
Vladimir's visuals are not bad per se but they are a bit dated. He could have a MF/Kassadin level visual update.

replies.body:
Current expectation is that there'll be visual updates to support kit changes, but not otherwise. Same approach as with the marksmen update for example.

A lot of the artists on the Champion Update team are focused primarily, or entirely, on the full scale relaunches like Poppy, Taric etc. For those we target a full visual overhaul, whereas the class updates are gameplay driven work with art updates focused on what needs to be changed to make small to medium sized adjustments to kits.
Does it mean that {{champion:101}} ultimate won't be touched even if you take a look at Artillery Mages? His R visuals is the "Place holder" that is living longer than some metas.

>Current expectation is that there'll be visual updates to support kit changes, but not otherwise. Same approach as with the marksmen update for example.

Just double checking, this would be like how Graves got new particle effects and updated animations to match his new abilities or Corki's model with the package, correct?

As much as I understand that visual updates take a lot more work than most realize... I REALLY would love visual updates (particularly to their models) to a number of champions that don't need full scale relaunches. There are some pretty bad and simple champion models hanging around that feel more and more out of place.

Riot needs to learn the spell that conjures skilled and experienced artists that work for cheap out of thin air. :p

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AuFA9cyT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-01-26T08:43:50.004+0000)
>
> Current expectation is that there'll be visual updates to support kit changes, but not otherwise. Same approach as with the marksmen update for example.
> 
> A lot of the artists on the Champion Update team are focused primarily, or entirely, on the full scale relaunches like Poppy, Taric etc. For those we target a full visual overhaul, whereas the class updates are gameplay driven work with art updates focused on what needs to be changed to make small to medium sized adjustments to kits.

You know if there's one champ I could go years without seeing a rework for, it's Malz. He's the first champion I consider perfect for me based on design, lore, theme and playstyle (with very unique things going on there). I'm sure Riot's approach to his rework is making his Voidlings a more defining factor in combat while loosening his edges around his ult for more counterplay. Let me just say. . . DONT DO IT! I as an AP malz player often forget about the voidling after a few levels and I would hate if riot revolved his kit on using them for combat and this subtracted power from the rest of his kit. I am person who likes consistency (it's my nature) I don't think it'd be fair to malz to put a large sum of his power into an aspect of his kit he has limited control of.  At least annie can control tibbers :/ Also I can argue that Malz ultimate is great as it is. He is a slow mage with an ult that is single targeted and makes him completely immobile. A good malz player must have a strong sense of when and where when utilizing ult in teamfights. His ult is really what ties the synergy of the rest of his kit together and is the only CC this immobile mage has. He is great and to me is the best creation of Mage/Assassin after {{champion:103}} I've seen to date, {{champion:7}} is the worst. You really feel the intensity when playing against a Malz player... and feel the surge of power when playing with him.

But you can atleast make Vlad's hands a bit smaller right? I may be asking for much here since it'll affect all his skins but I think his claws are a bit too big :/
Thanks for the reply! I kinda expected that answer but one can hope that some of the old models get improved someday. Not in this update but hopefully someday! :)

"A lot of the artists on the Champion Update team are focused primarily, or entirely, on the full scale relaunches like Poppy, Taric etc." 

Speaking of Taric, is he close to being revealed, or do you need to work more on him? 

I hope his joke is retained. He would not be Taric without a spammable joke to annoy the other 3 laners :D

Just one question. Im a huge fans of this massive reworks that Riot is doing. In a future will tanks or slayers suffer a similar massive reworks so they can had really diferrents gameplays?

PD: sorry for the English
